item.description:
Check out Design the Night: Trends series at the RISD Museum!

This is the last of the Design the Night series that the museum has been doing over the summer months. This looks to be a good one!

I will be checking out the Artist Lab, Hands-On Art: Sculptural Headpiece, "Herb & Dorothy" movie, then checking out the"Dorothy and Herbert Vogel Collections: Fifty Works for RI"exhibit and watching Brown Bird. All are welcome to join me or participate in whatever you like, and come and go as you please. This is NOT an organized meetup, but an FYI instead, since its a large space and everyone may have different activities they would like to experience. However, please RSVP so we know who is coming and can look for you! Perhaps we can meetup around 9:00 to check out Brown Bird in the plaza.

"Herb & Dorothy" trailer: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=R9oLCUNybQM&feature=relmfu

Brown Bird: http://brownbird.net/

The schedule of the evening's events are below:

DESIGN THE NIGHT: TRENDS

Thursday, August 16, 2012
5–10 pm | Museum Galleries + Chace Center Plaza

Celebrate identity and image, from 19th-century “It Girl” Madame Récamier to today’s trendsetters. Watch design demonstrations of historic hair styles and clothing. Meet Herb& Dorothy in a true film about a modest but visionary art-collecting couple—and see part of their vast collection at the Museum. Live music on the plaza keeps the festivities going past closing time!  MORE happenings + details to come!

The Artist's Lab 5–7 pm
Museum Galleries

Join an experimental drop-in artist's lab with interdisciplinary artist Beth Nixon, whose work involves puppets, personas, and unexpected interactions.



Designers on Design 5:30–6 pm
Grand Gallery Robert Babigian, owner of the downtown men’s boutique and private-label brand WHARF Clothing & Wares, critiques a fashionable French family painted in the 19th century.

Hands-On Art: Sculptural Headpiece 6–8 pm
Museum Galleries Construct a fantastical wig or chapeau using commonplace materials under the guidance of art instructor Paul Carpentier. Each session is inspired by works on view. All materials provided, no experience necessary.

Fashion Advice Booth 6:30–8 pm
Grand Gallery Fashion-challenged? Stuck in a style rut? Karen Beebe, owner and buyer of the downtown fashion boutique Queen of Hearts and sleek shoe store Modern Love, offers expert opinions on wardrobe quandaries.

‘Herb & Dorothy’ 6:30 pm
Metcalf Auditorium, Chace Center Meet the Vogels, a postal clerk and a librarian of modest means who built—and later donated—one of the world’s finest collections of contemporary art. Screened in conjunction with the Museum’s new exhibition, The Dorothy and Herbert Vogel Collection: Fifty Works for Rhode Island. (2008/85 min./not rated) Co-sponsored by Cable Car Cinema.

Live Music: BROWN BIRD 8–10 pm
Chace Center Plaza The duo performs original music influenced by the blues, outlaw country, roots rock, early American folk, and Gypsy and Eastern European music. Influenced from a deep understanding of American folklore, tradition, and musical style, Brown Bird transports the listener through time with bass and tambourine rhythms and direct, powerful vocal harmonies.
item.how_to_find_us: This is posted as an FYI - I will probably be going to the movie and then wander the galleries wearing the usual blue gradaded scarf. Look for me.
item.name: P-Collective FYI - Design the Night:TRENDS at the RISD Museum!
